name: Kee's Hotel and Leisure Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Kees for 2 nights while visiting family in Ballybofey. My wife and I had booked a Junior Suite B&B package which was 80Euro per night, which considering the size of the room and standard of the breakfast was fantastic value.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was clean and well furnished, with a large double bed, a seperate lounge/media area with a single bed, desk, music system and television. The only minor issues were the free wifi which failed to connect, and the extremely low shower head. Also our room (115) was right beside the door at the top of the main staircase from bar to bedroom area, so we heard the occassional slammed door and raised voice through the night, but nothing too disrupting.
reviews.title: Spacious comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool/spa/leisure centre looked a little tired but was perfectly adequate. The breakfast was a buffet of the usual cooked offerings as well as cereal, porridge, pancakes and croissants.
reviews.title: Excellent :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff were all extremely helpful and cheerful, and it was a thoroughly enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Lovelt Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and three friends took advantage of the Kees Hotel Offer, two nights bed and breakfast and evening meal.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful stay at Kee's Hotel. It was my first time to stay there so there is always a risk. However, my apprehension was misguided. The staff were so attentive and the overall service was superb. Oh...and did I mention how it was great value for money!!
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our Wedding Day at Kee's Hotel and felt it was practically stress free due to the friendly staff and the service provided by the hotel, which was of the highest standards. The food was delicious and I had many compliments about the meal from guests. The staff were very attentive and accomodating to both the bridal party and guests. I found that my wedding reception ran smoothly and that the flexibility, advice and attention to detail provided by the hotel in the run up to the wedding reassuring and helpful. Thanks :)
reviews.title: Wedding @ Kee's Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had our Wedding in Kees, wow what a weekend. Hotel looked great, Gallery magical for ceremony, staff,food, hospitality second to none. If anyone thinking of getting married in Donegal look no further. You will not find more helpful, friendly staff, they really know their jobs. All our guests commented on the food and hospitality. I recommend Kees wholeheartedly. We both felt like family.
reviews.title: wedding in Kees 24.8.12

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Kee's Hotel was great for a family affordable weekend! but if your looking for perfection look elsewhere, but if you want somewhere where the staff look after you and it comfortable then the Kees is value for money
reviews.title: Great Family Weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Attended a wedding on the 24/8/12 food very good,again staff couldnt do enough for you.Hotel rooms clean and fit for purpose an overall very nice day and night .definitely worth a try .The price of the room was a bit exspensive but given that it was a wedding it can be expected.Never stayed in this hotel nor eaten there before but would happily do so again .That line that takes in Ballybofey and Stranlorlar is a very friendly place to be the staff and general population very hospitable .
reviews.title: Another credit to that part of Donegal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for one night and really enjoyed this hotel.rooms were clean.food was 1st class,and the staff were very freindly,swimming pool is a good size enjoyed the swim just the right tempature , what more can i say . Breda and Joe
reviews.title: loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married in Kee's hotel on the 17th Aug.... We had the whole day in the hotel, ceremony and all. I have to say that the staff (especially Paul) made our day very special..... they set up everything for us to perfection so we had very little stress and worry on the run up to the wedding, any questions we had Vicky and Richard were more than happy to help us with our queries! The food was first class and alot of it, all our guests thought the food was outstanding and they weren't hungry after it... nothing as worse as going to a wedding and getting tiny portions but this doesn't happen in Kee's for sure!! The set up at night went smoothly and the food yet again brilliant!! I have to say I would recommend this hotel to anyone if it's for a night away or for a wedding, The staff, service, food, location, rooms are first class! Many thanks again you helped make our day stress free and perfect!!! (A special wee thank you to Paul for being at our bec and call during the wedding... your a star!) Julianne and Connor
reviews.title: Wedding.....17th August 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel during our tour of Ireland recently. It is a fine hotel, located in a quaint and pleasant location in town. The hotel was well kept, the staff very friendly, meals were excellent. They provided me with a full complement of gluten free meals because I am a celiac. I would highly recommend this establishment to anybody.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: really enjoyed this hotel. it had lovely feel to it great atmosphere and i will be going back sooner rather than later i hope. everything about this hotel from we arrived to we left was good. really could not fault it in any way
reviews.title: LOVELY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I had stayed in the hotel many times before, but our last time here was shocking. I always get the superior rooms when I stay here. When we arrived are check in process was pleasant as always and staff were friendly. We arrived in our room and noticed how cold it was put thought perhaps the heating was not coming on until later so we did not mind too much as we were intending to go down to the leisure centre and beauty salon . After a fun time at the leisure centre and beauty salon where all staff are lovely and helpful and professional we went back to our room where it was still very cold. This was November so we were really feeling the cold at this stage. We had dinner booked in the restaurant as usual so went down there and were surprised how cold it was there too. Our meals took a long while to come out and when dinner was served the meat was turkey and ham had to be sent back as the meat was cold . Then when we scooped up the mashed potato we noticed other bits of carrot stuck underneath the mash. I am not sure why that was there as there was no carrot being served with the veg. Our main course came back out ten minutes later but at this point the vegetables were cold. When I asked for them to be heated I was not met by helpful staff!!!!!. I got a snappy yes with no apology. By the end of the meal we were just happy to finish up and get to our room where we learned the heating was still not on. At this point we did contact reception where 15 minutes later they sent up someone who stayed 40 minutes trying to fix it as we sat there as he worked on the radiators in the rooms . He could not fix this so went away again and 10 minutes later came back with two electric heaters that we were told we could use, when asked what about during the night we were told we could leave them on all night to keep warm. We were not intending to do that as we felt it may be a bit unsafe to leave two electric heaters burning but providing we could get the room warm by then we figured it would be OK and we would just turn them off. After saying goodnight the man left and I went to have a bath. After running the bath I went to put my leg in the bath only to find under the bubbles dirt and dead flies floating in the bath. Horrified, I got dressed and rang reception. Another man came up and viewed it for himself . There are signs in this bathroom that the water may contain things as it comes from a natural source but in all the times i have stayed in this room in the past this had never happened before and I was shocked how much dirt and dead flies came out. As I mentioned before I have stayed here many times and this was my worst experience. I do not know if the time of year had any relevance to what happened or if it was just bad luck. Unfortunately It ruined our trip and we left at half 1 in the morning, to drive the hour journey back home.We had been staying here for a special occasion and it was ruined . Although our experience was bad this time we did have many wonderful times here. It has been a lovely hotel for us in the past it may just have been an unlucky stay for us this time.
reviews.title: Disappointing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married abroad and had our wedding reception in kees hotel on our return. I would like to thank paul and all the staff for making our reception perfect. Right from the begining at booking stage paul was extremly helpful, he had great ideas to make our day tie in with our destination wedding, and nothing was a bother. ive heard many of brides stress because the hotel was dictating what had to be and when, there was no such pressure with keys! We went down early on the saturday as we had tvs etc to show our wedding dvd, we were greeted with a smile, expecting to give a had to set up we were told there was champagne in our room, go relax and get ready to greet your guests. The set up was perfect, meal was delious especially my hot choc cake. The service was top class and there was lots of clean plates. Nothing left to do but dance the night away! We had a fantatic day the atmosphere was relaxed, perfect.....
reviews.title: Wedding at kees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed the night with a 5 in the morning finish, the breakfast next morning was superb buffet fry all you could eat, pancakes, cereals n lots more.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: All the staff were extermely helpful and couldnt do enough for us, treated like king and queen! The differences in a family hotel really stood out. I would strongly recommend this hotel for a relaxing weekend and to any bride who wants the perfect day with no stress. Thank you all very much, with special thanks to paul. Janine & Gareth
reviews.title: Fantastic food and comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Kee's Hotel is absolutely charming place to stay in Donegal. This is the type of Hotel that you expect in this part of the country not a modern building. The decor and the furnishings are amazing. You will be mezmerized on how they preserved the beautiful building. Nicely decorated room and very comfy bed. The breakfast was great and the dinner was superb. Restaurant is nicely appointed and the bar is very cozy with the fire on. And lastly, the staff are amazing. You feel really welcome. 10 out of 10 for Kee's Hotel. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: The best staff in Donegal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights this time. Our favourite hotel in the area. Breakfasts are wonderful and a buffet do you can help yourself to as much/little as you want. A great choice for dinner. Their fillet steak is very tender!!! We used their leisure club to unwind. Clean pool and loved their sauna. They have s gym but I was too lazy to use it. While we were there they had a wedding fayre. We had a nosey around. They were busy with lots of people booking. Highlight was there Sunday lunch carvery. We usually fly into Derry airport as its a 40 minute drive here. Would highly recommend it. WARNING if your looking for a modern Sheraton like hotel then book else where. If your looking for a beautifully decorated individual hotel with dark wood, comfy conservatory, with great service and food then book here.
reviews.title: hidden gem in Donegal

description: In the twin towns of Stranorlar and Ballybofey, near the foothills of the Bluestack Mountains, you'll find Donegal's warmest welcome at Kee's Hotel, family run since 1892. The bedrooms are bright and comfortable, offering the high standards expected by any seasoned traveller. The restaurant offers the finest local seasonal specialities. Spend quality time in the gym, sauna, pool or beauty salon. Ideally located for hill-walking, golf and touring. Numerous awards from international tour operators.
